Articles.Content:
Now, you probably learned all this in English class, but for those who didn't: haiku is a Japanese form of poetry. It doesn't have to rhyme, like most poetry. Instead, it's main feature is that it is always exactly seventeen syllables--no more, no less. It's harder than it sounds.

Anyway, I was thinking. What if we started a thread for haiku about KSP? Might as well start it here.

Exploding can be fun,

But not when you've spent time landing on Duna!

Edited August 16, 2013 by The Jedi Master

Aren't haikus seventeen syllables?

Also, your haiku is eighteen syllables, just so you know.

Sorry for the nitpicking

Aren't haikus seventeen syllables?

Also, your haiku is eighteen syllables, just so you know.

Sorry for the nitpicking

1)One number off... one number...

2)Maybe I'm counting wrong, but I've got seventeen syllables from my count.

After several counts, I'm still getting eighteen syllables. Knock the 'yes' off the first sentence and it's a haiku that makes perfect sense. Right now it just makes sense, no haiku there

I believe this is seventeen syllables, and it's also my first attempt at a haiku:

A speck in space,

venturing out to the deep reaches of the cosmos

Just to add more to your thread, which I'm sure will get to be very interesting indeed

Let me try

I know it looks pretty funny

Though it should go to mun in one piece.

I was taught that Haiku was 17, but in three phrases; 5, 7, 5.

Alone I sit

In my command module

Reflecting life

RT5 fired

Creates paperwork for me

Gene was not happy

A blast of flame

Within the inky darkness

Jeb K. lights his fart

Too many die young:

Sobs shaking in last terror

Cries cut short, they crash

Battery now empty

Fuel tanks long cold and dry

The slow, thick air cools

I roar through the air,

A column of fire beneath,

To know the cosmos.

---

I personally prefer blank verse.

-Duxwing

A blast of flame

Within the inky darkness

Jeb K. lights his fart

Too many die young:

Sobs shaking in last terror

Cries cut short, they crash

Battery now empty

Fuel tanks long cold and dry

The slow, thick air cools

I roar through the air,

A column of fire beneath,

To know the cosmos.

---

I personally prefer blank verse.

-Duxwing

Did you created 4 haikus?

Jebediah ride the booster

And fly it to space

Just to cry: "SPACE!!!"

Yes, I did. They're easier to make once you get used to the rhythm.

-Duxwing

Towards space we went

Drifting fuelless eh forever

I say, "Well Shee.. ...eeet"

One forgot to save

Workload lost somewhat for good

Pissed off restart, eh?

Here we, on kerbin;

don't bother on the testings.

Just build, fly, and see!

Bob

Dark sky of purple

Setting foot on the pale sand

First to visit hell

Bob

Dark sky of purple

Setting foot on the pale sand

First to visit hell

No! Don't do that!

But, anyway, suggestion to move to off topic? I do not know if this is in the right category right now.

But, anyway: (2X ANYWAY COMBO!)

Trapped on top of Dres

Landing legs are not on ship

You done messed up son.

Go to space today?

Go on some grand adventure?

CRASH! Sigh, I think not...
